What is the mechanism of action of Bitcoin?

Bitcoin is a decentralized digital currency that operates on a peer-to-peer network called blockchain. The main components of this system are cryptographic algorithms, consensus mechanisms, and distributed ledger technology.

Here's an overview of the mechanisms behind Bitcoin:

1. Transactions: Users send or receive Bitcoins by creating transactions. A transaction consists of input (the source address(es) from which funds came), output (the destination address(es) where funds will go), and digital signatures to verify its authenticity.

2. Blockchain: All confirmed transactions are recorded in blocks together within the blockchainâ€”a public ledger that bears all historical cryptocurrency exchanges ever made since bitcoin was created in 2009; hence promoting transparency.
